alert.note: Alert for Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 25 at 12:53PM CDT until August 25 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Washington County in southwestern Alabama... Northern Greene County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 345 PM CDT. * At 1253 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen very quickly. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... State Line, Fruitdale, Clark, Old Avera, Knobtown, Jonathan, Yellow Pine, Escatawpa, Four Point, Burbank, Avera, Bothwell, Piave, Vinegar Bend, Byrd and Sand Hill. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
